incidents.name: Issues with Private Network CIDR Routes for WARP Connector

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare was investigating an issue affecting WARP Connector where traffic destined for specific Private IP CIDR ranges failed to route correctly for a small subset of accounts. 

This occurred between 2025-11-20 18:09 UTC to 2025-11-21 13:44 UTC. 

During this window, affected WARP Connectors may have appeared connected but failed to pass traffic to specific internal resources.

Our engineering team identified the underlying cause and deployed a fix. This issue is fully resolved now.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare services are currently operating normally. We are no longer observing elevated errors or latency across the network.

Our engineering teams continue to closely monitor the platform and perform a deeper investigation into the earlier disruption, but no configuration changes are being made at this time.

At this point, it is considered safe to re-enable any Cloudflare services that were temporarily disabled during the incident. We will provide a final update once our investigation is complete.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: We continue to monitor the system through recovery and we are seeing errors and latency return to normal levels. A full post-incident investigation and details about the incident will be made available asap.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: We continue to see errors drop as we work through services globally and clearing remaining errors and latency.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: We continue to see errors and latency improve but still have reports of intermittent errors. The team continues to monitor the situation as it improves, and looking for ways to accelerate full recovery.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: Bot scores will be impacted intermittently while we undergo global recovery. We will update once we believe bot scores are fully recovered.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: The team is continuing to focus on restoring service post-fix. We are mitigating several issues that remain post-deployment.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: Some customers may be still experiencing issues logging into or using the Cloudflare dashboard. We are working on a fix to resolve this, and continuing to monitor for any further issues.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we believe the incident is now resolved. We are continuing to monitor for errors to ensure all services are back to normal.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: We've deployed a change which has restored dashboard services.  We are still working to remediate broad application services impact

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: We are continuing working on restoring service for application services customers.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Bot Management

incident_updates.body: We are continuing working on restoring service for application services customers.

We have made changes that have allowed Cloudflare Access and WARP to recover. Error levels for Access and WARP users have returned to pre-incident rates. 
We have re-enabled WARP access in London.

We are continuing to work towards restoring other services.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
During our attempts to remediate, we have disabled WARP access in London.  Users in London trying to access the Internet via WARP will see a failure to connect.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are seeing services recover, but customers may continue to observe higher-than-normal error rates as we continue remediation efforts.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Cloudflare is experiencing an internal service degradation. Some services may be intermittently impacted. We are focused on restoring service. We will update as we are able to remediate. More updates to follow shortly.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Magic WAN

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare is currently investigating issues related to Magic WAN Connector configurations. Impacted customers may be unable to create, edit or delete Connector on-ramps.

Impact does not affect any existing Magic WAN traffic.

We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Cloudflare GraphQL API and Analytics issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare GraphQL API.

These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.

Customers using the GraphQL API and Dashboard Analytics may see errors.

components.name: Durable Objects
components.description: Durable Objects provide low-latency coordination and consistent permanent storage for the Workers platform.

components.name: R2
components.description: High-performance storage for files and objects with zero egress charges

components.name: Realtime SFU
components.description: Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

components.name: Realtime TURN Service
components.description:
Separately from the SFU, Realtime offers a managed TURN service. TURN acts as a relay point for traffic between WebRTC clients like the browser and SFUs, particularly in scenarios where direct communication is obstructed by NATs or firewalls. TURN maintains an allocation of public IP addresses and ports for each session, ensuring connectivity even in restrictive network environments.

Using Cloudflare Realtime TURN service is available free of charge when used together with the Realtime SFU. Otherwise, it costs $0.05/real-time GB outbound from Cloudflare to the TURN client.

components.name: RealtimeKit
components.description:
Build real-time serverless video, audio and data applications.

Cloudflare Realtime is infrastructure for real-time audio/video/data applications. It allows you to build real-time apps without worrying about scaling or regions. It can act as a selective forwarding unit (WebRTC SFU), as a fanout delivery system for broadcasting (WebRTC CDN) or anything in between.

components.description: Cloudflare Stream lets you or your end users upload, store, encode, and deliver live and on-demand video with one API, without configuring or maintaining infrastructure

incidents.name: Workers Tracing has been temporarily disabled

incident_updates.body:
Workers Automatic Tracing has been re-enabled.

User who had previously enabled tracing may need to redeploy with updated wrangler configuration including explicit opt-in to tracing using the 'observability.tracing.enabled' attribute.

For more details on how to enable tracing see the documentation here: https://developers.cloudflare.com/workers/observability/traces/#how-to-enable-tracing

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Workers Observability

incident_updates.body: Workers Tracing (beta) has been temporarily disabled for maintenance and will be re-enabled as soon as possible. This will also impact exporting OTel Workers Logs and Traces. This does not impact Workers Logpush.

incidents.name: Increase latency on R2 operations on WNAM buckets

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently investigating high long-tail latency on some R2 requests with buckets in the WNAM region. Impacted buckets will see increased latency on PutObject operations. Impacting Stream Live broadcasts, R2. Stream on-demand and media transformations are not affected.

incidents.name: Cloudflare WAF: Issues with Duplicate Rate Limiting Rules

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating an issue which potentially impacts multiple customers: zones that have migrated from our former Rate Limiting rules might observe duplicated rules. This means that in some cases, expected rate limiting rules are not taking effect. This impacts only customers that use rate limits based on response codes.

We are working to resolve the issue. More updates to follow shortly.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Stream Live when LL-HLS is used. LL-HLS video playback may be impacted.

Regular HLS URLs for active video streams are not impacted. Impacted videos can switch to regular HLS URLs for playback.

We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare has observed and resolved intermittent issues with Network Performance in Singapore. The impact started on 2025-11-07 08:28 UTC  (via our previous incident https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/7c77r1l1cm45) and ended today 2025-11-14 at 04:38 UTC.
